korean: 헬스장 등록은 했는데, 가는 게 진짜 쉽지 않아.
일주일에 세 번 가려고 했는데, 실제론 한두 번 가는 게 고작이야.
가기 전엔 귀찮은데, 막상 가면 또 괜찮더라고.
땀 흘리기 시작하면 기분이 좀 나아지는 것 같아.
근데 거울 보면 운동하는 자세가 이상한 것 같아서 신경 쓰여.
트레이너한테 PT 받을까 고민 중인데, 비용이 부담스러워.
헬스장 사람들 보면 다들 열심히 하는데, 나만 대충하는 것 같아.
물 자주 마시라고 하는데, 화장실 가기 귀찮아서 덜 마시게 돼.
한 시간 정도 운동하고 나면 샤워실 가는데, 거기도 사람 많아.
운동 끝나고 나면 몸이 무겁긴 한데, 뿌듯함은 있어.
다음 날 근육통 오는 게 싫은데, 그게 또 운동한 증거니까.
요즘 목표는 꾸준히 다니는 건데, 작심삼일이 될까 봐 걱정이야.
그래도 건강 생각하면 계속 가야겠지, 아무튼.
english: I signed up for a gym membership, but actually going is like, really not easy.
I was planning to go three times a week, but in reality I only go once or twice.
Before I go, I don't want to, but once I'm there it's actually okay, you know?
I start on the treadmill, and the first 5 minutes are the hardest.
Once I start sweating, I feel a bit better, I think.
But when I look in the mirror, my form seems weird and it makes me self-conscious.
I'm thinking about getting personal training, but the cost is kind of overwhelming.
When I look at other people at the gym, everyone's working so hard, and I feel like I'm just half-assing it.
They say to drink water often, but I don't want to go to the bathroom so I end up drinking less.
After working out for like an hour, I go to the shower, but there are so many people there too.
After the workout, my body feels heavy, but there's like, a sense of accomplishment.
I hate getting sore the next day, but that's also proof I worked out, so.
My goal these days is to go consistently, but I'm worried it'll just be a three-day thing.
Still, thinking about my health, I should keep going, anyway.
